name: Trivia Mixed Bag Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: What animal is called in various languages reynard, volpe and zorro?
questions.explanation:
Fox.

	The fox is reynard in French, volpe in Italian and el zorro in Spanish.

questions.text: What UK organisation has the initials ICE?
questions.explanation:
Institution of Civil Engineers.

	The Institution of Civil Engineers was founded back in 1818. The rest are made-up names.

questions.text: What were Jekyll and Hyde's first names?
questions.explanation:
Henry and Edward.

	Henry Jekyll and Edward Hyde are the protagonists of Robert Louis Stevenson's classic novel.

questions.text: Which two cities have districts called Kings Cross?
questions.explanation:
London and Sydney.

	Both London and Sydney have districts called Kings Cross which have diverse communities and a lively club scene.

questions.text: Of what tribe was Boadicea the chief?
questions.explanation:
Iceni.

	These are all different Celtic tribes. Boadicea or Boudicca became chief of the Iceni after her husband's death.

questions.text: What specialism is denoted by the initials MRCP as in John Smith MRCP?
questions.explanation:
Physician.

	MRCP stands for Member of the Royal College of Physicians.

Language.

	Lingala is one of the many (over 60) languages of central Africa.

questions.text: In what field is Ken Hom an expert?
questions.explanation:
Cookery.

	He is a great popularist of Chinese cookery, introducing the wok to millions of kitchens.

Decorative mineral.

	Nephrite along with jadeite is one of the sources of Jade.

questions.text: What is the name of Sir Winston Churchill's family home?
questions.explanation:
Chartwell.

	Chartwell was Churchill's house, now a museum. Charterhouse is the name given to various buildings formerly Carthusian foundations, including a famous school. Cherwell is a tributary of the river Thames at Oxford. Chatham House is the home of the Royal Institute of International Affairs.
